page.title: 20Farming
page.content: {Spittalriddinghill,}our other farm, also has an interesting name. The place where the farm buildings now stand was originally a hospital, hence 'Spittal'. The farm is rather smaller than Limekilns, about 240 acres or 90 hectares. Most of the livestock are calves and bullocks and there is one cow and a few sheep. Most of the 16 fields are in grass for silage and hay. Peas, beans, barley, winter wheat, turnips and potatoes are also grown. Only a very small number of farms in our area are privately owned. Most are tenanted with the land belonging to the{Hoddom and Kinmount Estates.}
